full_text: Baha BER eie eA 2016/KER/33663 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE RAJA VJAYARAGHAVAN V MONDAY, THE 1ST DAY OF AUGUST 2016/10TH SRAVANA, 1938 Crl.MC.No. 4365 of 2016 () CC. NO.255/2016 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-I, PALAKKAD. PETITIONER/ACCUSED NO.4: M.P. MANI, SON OF PAKKAN, MALANCHITTI HOUSE, KUTHANUR. BY ADVS.SRIP.K.NIJOY, SMT.C.PRABITHA. RESPONDENTISTATE: STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI,AMJAD ALI. THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 01-08-2016, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: rs Baha zis ae am raat 2016/KER/33663 Cri.MC.No. 4365 of 2016 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S ANNEXURES:- ANNEXURE | CERTIFIED COPY OF THE JUDGMENT DATED 19.03.2016 OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT I, PALAKKAD. RESPONDENT'S ANNEXURES:- NIL. /TTRUE COPY// P.S. TO JUDGE rs Pagel s016ikERa3663 RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV., J ~ CrLM.C. No. 4365 of 2016 Dated 1* August, 2016 ORDER 1.The petitioner is the 3 accused in C.C.No.255 of 2016 on the files of the Judicial Magistrate of 1* Class I, Palakkad. He faces allegations for having committed offences punishable under Section 420 read with Section 34 of the IPC. 2.This is a split up case from C.C.No.14 of 2008 in which the petitioner was arrayed as 4" accused. The case was proceeded with and as per judgment dated 19.3.2016, accused 2 and 5 were acquitted under Section 248(1) of the Code of Criminal Procedure (hereinafter referred to as the Code). 3.The learned counsel submits that coercive steps are pending against the petitioner and prays that necessary directions be given to the learned Magistrate to consider his application for recall of warrant and grant of bail. Ease wae 1 isaare 2016/KER/33663 Crl.M.C. No. 4365 of 2016 -2- 4.Heard the learned Public Prosecutor as well. 5.It is for the petitioner to approach the court below and appraise the reasons for his absence and to seek for recalling the warrant and grant of Bail. There is no reason for this Court to assume that the learned Magistrate will not exercise his discretion judicially and in accordance with law. 6.In the result, the petitioner is directed to surrender before the learned Magistrate within 2 weeks from the date of this order and prefer application for recall of warrant and also for grant of bail with advance notice to the prosecutor concerned. In that event the learned Magistrate is directed to consider and dispose of the said application, preferably on the same day itself, on its merits and in accordance with law. Petition is disposed off as above. Sd/- RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV., JUDGE kp/-3.8.16
